Full Job Description

Executive Communications Assistant 

Location: Milton Keynes (Flexibility to work remotely and onsite)
Hours: 37.5 hours per week, 52 weeks per year 
Flexible Working: We welcome applications from those seeking flexible hours 
Salary: Up to £30,000 per annum (Subject to experience) 
Reporting to: CEO & Group Principal

IN SHORT 

We are looking for an exceptional communicator to assist our leadership team in developing presentations, reports and in presenting data, board papers and speeches. You will work across our leadership team, attending meetings, making notes and gaining context to be able to make recommendations and develop corporate communications. 
Key to this role will be a strong relationship with our in-house marketing team, to ensure that all communications are consistent with our brand style and tone of voice. You will also need to have strong analytical abilities and experience of research. 
This exciting role will see you support with the creation and development of corporate documents such as our Fairer Futures strategy and College Self-Assessment Report (SAR) whilst writing speeches and presentations for our CEO and other senior leaders. As a copywriting specialist you will also assist in the production of bids and tenders. 

Equality, Diversity, and Inclusion practices are a priority for the MK College Group especially in terms of the HR Services we provide. We’re looking for individuals who have experience and/or a real interest in inclusive and positive action. 

MK College will treat all applicants fairly and with respect, irrespective of their background, disability or any other individual characteristic. We particularly encourage applications from people with backgrounds which are currently under-represented within Milton Keynes College. All offers made to successful candidates are subject to satisfactory outcomes to a range of pre-employment checks including a Disclosure and Barring Service check (DBS). In addition, security clearance is required for all prison services positions up to Counter Terrorist Check (CTC) level. 

OUR BENEFITS 

30 days annual leave, 3 additional company closure days and UK Bank Holidays (entitlement will be pro-rated for part-time employees) 
Generous Pension Scheme 
Professional development opportunities, including professional qualifications 
Employee Assistance Programme (EAP) accessible 24 hours per day, 365 days per year 
A variety of amazing discounts with NUS Card and our reward and recognition platform Encore 
Employee wellbeing platform.

Campus: Hybrid/Hull
Faculty/Area: Student Recruitment and Marketing Directorate
School/Department: Brand and Digital
Subject Group/Team: Communications Team
Salary: £38,205 to £44,263 (31 days holiday+ bank holidays / flexible & hybrid working)
Post Type: Full Time
Closing Date: Sunday 11 August 2024

Applicants are expected to submit a CV and covering letter. We reserve the right to close the advert early if a satisfactory amount of applications have been received. 

At the University of Hull, we’ve been challenging people to think differently for almost 100 years. At Hull, you can expect academic excellence, state of the art facilities and the chance to play your part in tackling the big issues facing humanity. We are research leaders in clean energy, flood resilience, cancer and wound care and the fight against modern slavery. We change the world for the better. 

Working in collaboration with colleagues internally and externally our growing Communications team (part of our Marketing and Student Services Recruitment team) strives to tell our story and build our reputation, across a range of audiences and channels and in line with our new identity and brand. 

As Internal Communications Manager, you will lead communications campaigns and initiatives to engage our staff community and build a sense of belonging and pride.

For more information about the University of Hull, please visit https://www.hull.ac.uk/

Specific Duties and Responsibilities:

-Provide insights, information and ideas to senior managers and leaders in Communications and the University to advise and guide on the development and delivery of an internal communications strategy and plans to reflect the University’s objectives to build an informed and engaged staff community. 

-Support the Director of Communications and the Senior Internal Communications Manager with the development of the Communications Strategy, and be responsible for delivering the internal communications elements of this strategy.

-Initiate, lead and manage a range of internal communications campaigns to engage and involve colleagues in University initiatives, achievements, progress and issues as required.

-Brief, create and oversee relevant and engaging content to support these campaigns and embrace the University’s identity and brand.

-Monitor and feedback on the effectiveness of these activities to stakeholders across the University, including senior leaders.

-Support the University’s engagement with colleagues in response to critical incidents, by managing staff engagement around incidents, liaising with Communications team colleagues and the Rapid Response team as required.

-Manage the University's communication channels including the new staff portal. This includes creating strategies and processes for updating, retiring and managing content and migrating content from other sites. 

The postholder will liaise with the development team, supervising and supporting colleagues inputting content and training and supporting a team of Super Users from across all University departments, and report to the ULT project sponsor on progress and challenges.

Please see attached Job Description for more information about the post. For an informal conversation regarding the position please contact: Stacey Dixon - s.y.dixon@hull.ac.uk

House of Commons

The House of Commons is a unique and exciting place to work right at the heart of the UK's thriving democratic system. Behind the scenes, the House of Commons Service is made up of more than 3,000 employees who support and facilitate the smooth day to day running of the House. They provide professional services to Members of Parliament, their staff, and the wider parliamentary community.

Staff Benefits 

In addition to your salary, we offer an attractive range of benefits including:
- 30 days’ annual leave (increasing to 35 days after first full leave year).
- Civil Service pension with an average employer contribution of 27%.
- Access to training and development.
- Flexible working.
- Interest free season ticket loan and bicycle loan.

Introduction

You will be working in the Select Committee Team (SCT), supporting the work of the House of Commons select committees. Select committees are cross-party committees of MPs who examine government policy and spending. This post is part of SCT Communications, a team of communications, digital and engagement professionals that provides a dedicated service to select committees.

The Role

The Communications and Engagement Apprentice works across the Select Committee Communications Team. The team works together to promote select committee work, and facilitate targeted public engagement campaigns. During your apprenticeship, you will work closely with three teams within SCT Communications, gaining the skills and experience needed to support the communications of select committee work. This includes creating content, developing effective communications plans, and planning, measuring and evaluating communications and engagement activities. Your role will include supporting the planning of communications activity across all three teams. This role is an apprenticeship. Successful candidates will be enrolled on the Level 4 Public Relations and Communication apprenticeship and will complete training for 20% of their time, including from an apprenticeship training provider. More information on the apprenticeship can be found here: Public relations and communications assistant / Institute for Apprenticeships and Technical Education.

In this role, you will:
- Contribute to the overall planning calendar of committee communications, helping bring together different sources of information and supporting planning meetings. 
- Support the Digital and Publishing team to facilitate online public contributions to inquiries through surveys, polls and crowd-sourcing campaigns
- Monitor and, where appropriate, communicate directly with online communities including moderating discussions, upholding community guidelines, signposting information and answering questions about committee work
- Work closely with committee teams, Digital Account Managers, Media and Communications Officers and Engagement Officers to understand audience needs. 

Skills and Experience

To be successful in this role you will demonstrate:
- Ability to work towards excellent written and oral communications skills, which includes grasping complex issues quickly and communicating them accurately and effectively to different audiences.
- Ability to understand and engage successfully with a range of people, with an awareness of audience diversity and an ability to tailor messages to attract the interest of people from diverse backgrounds.
- Ability to work successfully on your own and in a team, this includes working under pressure, identifying and adapting priorities to changing circumstances and tackling complex tasks and issues.
- Interest in Parliament and/or current affairs, and an understanding of risk management. 

Next Steps and Additional Information

Application Form - If you would like to apply for this role, please submit an application providing evidence against criteria 2,3 & 4 in the Job Description. There will also likely be some form of task. More information on the role and the full criteria can be found in the Job Description. Please note that most job offers will be made at the minimum of the salary range, other than in exceptional circumstances. #LI-Hybrid

Description and requirements
Skanska Group uses knowledge and foresight to shape the way people live, work and connect. More than 135 years in the making, we’re one of the world’s largest development and construction companies, with 2023 revenue totalling SEK 157 billion (around £11.9 billion). We operate across select markets in the Nordics, Europe and the United States. Skanska is listed on the Stockholm stock exchange and headquartered in Sweden’s capital city.

Our £1 billion+ operation in the UK has more than 3,300 local experts delivering construction projects and facilities management contracts across sectors including real estate, defence, education, transportation, healthcare and water.

As a Senior Communications Business Partner, you will have overall responsibility for internal and external communications strategy and delivery for our Building and Building Services operating units (divisions). These units deliver construction, facilities management and mechanical & electrical engineering across all our sectors and geographies. This role reports to the Skanska UK Communications Director.

What you'll do:

Develop and implement the communication strategy and plan (internal and external) for the assigned operating units, including delivery of tactical activities.
Provide counsel to executives about communications strategy, tactics and responses.
Develop and deliver the B2B and account-based marketing strategy and plan, including events, email marketing and paid social, aligning to Skanska’s brand position and value proposition.
Support employee engagement and delivery of internal change programmes through targeted, inclusive communications, leadership updates, regular news and town-hall events (digital and in-person).
Proactively own relationships with target media, developing and pitching editorial opportunities and lead crisis and issues communications for your areas of responsibility.
Manage Group Press Releases in line with stock market regulations and internal governance, liaising with internal stakeholders, including Investor Relations, and customers.
Contribute to driving the UK communications strategy and developing the newly restructured communications department, ensuring that our priorities are fully integrated with the overall business strategy.
Manage, develop and provide strategic direction for your direct report, an experienced communications business partner.

What you'll bring to the role:

Experience of working in a senior in-house role and practice in all of the core communications disciplines.
Passion and a proven track record for media relations, crisis and issues management and B2B marketing.
Excellent writing and comprehension skills with the ability to strategically join the dots.
Sound decision maker, with the ability to combine strong strategic thinking with hands-on implementation.
A strong relationship builder who can build rapport at every level, with the credibility and authority to engage and influence senior leaders.
Proactive, can-do and resourceful mindset, able to maximise impact and value and continuously improve within existing resources.
Resilience and agility, ability to prioritise and manage competing demands and adapt quickly to changing business needs.
A relevant degree/equivalent (eg English, journalism, marketing or PR) is an advantage, as is experience of construction, facilities management or similar engineering-based industries.

Location 
The role is based at Skanska UK’s head office in Watford, with frequent travel to our central London office, 51 Moorgate. We always try to offer flexible working arrangements where possible, in line with business requirements. You will be expected to spend at least three days a week based in the offices or visiting projects. You can take a flexible approach to the remaining two days, dependent on your work commitments. 

Equal opportunities
We thrive through embracing differences, whether they be social backgrounds, ethnicity, disability, gender identity or expression, age, religion, sexual orientation and any other protected characteristic – we know that diversity opens a rich potential for new ways of thinking, helping us to build successful and high-performing teams. We call it Naturally Skanska.

Flexible working
We welcome you to ask about flexibility at interview stage and we will explore what is possible for the role.

Reasonable adjustments
We would like you to perform at your best at every stage of our recruitment process. Please contact us using recruitment@skanska.co.uk if you require any adjustments that would support you throughout your application.

More information about the role
Please note this is an advert for our job vacancy, and therefore may not be inclusive of all assigned duties, responsibilities, or aspects of the role described, and may be amended at any time at the sole discretion of Skanska. For a full role profile, please contact us: recruitment@skanska.co.uk

Closing date
The closing date for this vacancy may be subject to change any time at the sole discretion of the business.
We are a 2024 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

House of Commons

The House of Commons is a unique and exciting place to work right at the heart of the UK's thriving democratic system. Behind the scenes, the House of Commons Service is made up of more than 3,000 employees who support and facilitate the smooth day to day running of the House. They provide professional services to Members of Parliament, their staff, and the wider parliamentary community. 

Staff Benefits

In addition to your salary, we offer an attractive range of benefits including:

30 days’ annual leave (increasing to 35 days after first full leave year).

Civil Service pension with an average employer contribution of 27%.

Access to training and development.

Flexible working.

Interest free season ticket loan and bicycle loan. 

Introduction

You will be working in the Select Committee Team (SCT), supporting the work of the House of Commons select committees. Select committees are cross-party committees of MPs who examine government policy and spending. This post is part of SCT Communications, a team of communications, digital and engagement professionals that provides a dedicated service to select committees. 

The Role

The Communications and Engagement Apprentice works across the Select Committee Communications Team. The team works together to promote select committee work, and facilitate targeted public engagement campaigns. During your apprenticeship, you will work closely with three teams within SCT Communications, gaining the skills and experience needed to support the communications of select committee work. This includes creating content, developing effective communications plans, and planning, measuring and evaluating communications and engagement activities. Your role will include supporting the planning of communications activity across all three teams. This role is an apprenticeship. Successful candidates will be enrolled on the Level 4 Public Relations and Communication apprenticeship and will complete training for 20% of their time, including from an apprenticeship training provider. More information on the apprenticeship can be found here: Public relations and communications assistant / Institute for Apprenticeships and Technical Education. 

In this role, you will:

Contribute to the overall planning calendar of committee communications, helping bring together different sources of information and supporting planning meetings. 

Support the Digital and Publishing team to facilitate online public contributions to inquiries through surveys, polls and crowd-sourcing campaigns

Monitor and, where appropriate, communicate directly with online communities including moderating discussions, upholding community guidelines, signposting information and answering questions about committee work

Work closely with committee teams, Digital Account Managers, Media and Communications Officers and Engagement Officers to understand audience needs. 

Skills and Experience

To be successful in this role you will demonstrate:

Ability to work towards excellent written and oral communications skills, which includes grasping complex issues quickly and communicating them accurately and effectively to different audiences.

Ability to understand and engage successfully with a range of people, with an awareness of audience diversity and an ability to tailor messages to attract the interest of people from diverse backgrounds.

Ability to work successfully on your own and in a team, this includes working under pressure, identifying and adapting priorities to changing circumstances and tackling complex tasks and issues.

Interest in Parliament and/or current affairs, and an understanding of risk management. 

Next Steps and Additional Information

There will also likely be some form of task. More information on the role and the full criteria can be found in the Job Description. Please note that most job offers will be made at the minimum of the salary range, other than in exceptional circumstances.

About the Role 

Base Location: Perth or Glasgow 
Salary: up to £40,000 + performance-related bonus + a range of benefits to support your finances, wellbeing and family. 
Working Pattern: Permanent | Full Time | Flexible First options available 

We have an exciting opportunity to join SSE’s Investor Relations team which is responsible for proactively managing the relationship, communication and engagement with SSE and its shareholders. The Investor Relations team plays a pivotal role in shaping the groups’ perception in the public markets, by ensuring that it effectively and objectively conveys SSE’s financial performance and strategic goals in line with market requirements. 

As Investor Relations Analyst, you’ll support the Director of Investor Relations as well as the wider Group Executive, Corporate Affairs, Sustainability and Strategy teams by facilitating the two-way flow of financial analysis and communication, while promoting effective dialogue between the financial community and the senior management team.

Maintaining relationships with the financial analyst community as well as effective relationships with SSE stakeholders. 
Interpreting and summarising sell-side analyst research notes. 
Leading on the KPI collection process and contributing to the delivery of financial results materials. 
Contributing to any RNS and other market or regulatory statements. 
Providing support to the Executive Team and Director of Investor Relations in their market facing roles.

To be considered for this role, we would love you to have:
Working towards, or soon to be working towards, a recognised financial qualification such as CFA or accountancy, as well as a relevant degree qualification in finance, business, or a related field. 
Understanding of financial analysis, financial markets, and accounting principles (UK IFRS). 
Good communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate complex financial information into easily understandable language. 
Awareness of relevant financial regulations and compliance standards. 
Experience in financial modelling and data analysis.

The Investor Relations Team is responsible for proactively managing the relationship and communication between SSE and its shareholders. SSE has big ambitions to be a leading energy company in a low carbon world. Following our commitment to invest £20.5 billion in low carbon projects to 2027, we have significant growth plans and are well on our way to achieving our ambition to build a world that's more sustainable and inclusive for you, your family, the community you live in and for generations to come. About the Role 

Base Location: Perth or Glasgow 

Salary: up to £40,000 + performance-related bonus + a range of benefits to support your finances, wellbeing and family.

Working Pattern: Permanent | Full Time | Flexible First options available 

We have an exciting opportunity to join SSE’s Investor Relations team which is responsible for proactively managing the relationship, communication and engagement with SSE and its shareholders. The Investor Relations team plays a pivotal role in shaping the groups’ perception in the public markets, by ensuring that it effectively and objectively conveys SSE’s financial performance and strategic goals in line with market requirements.

As Investor Relations Analyst, you’ll support the Director of Investor Relations as well as the wider Group Executive, Corporate Affairs, Sustainability and Strategy teams by facilitating the two-way flow of financial analysis and communication, while promoting effective dialogue between the financial community and the senior management team.

Maintaining relationships with the financial analyst community as well as effective relationships with SSE stakeholders.

Interpreting and summarising sell-side analyst research notes.

Leading on the KPI collection process and contributing to the delivery of financial results materials.

Contributing to any RNS and other market or regulatory statements.

Providing support to the Executive Team and Director of Investor Relations in their market facing roles.

To be considered for this role, we would love you to have:

Working towards, or soon to be working towards, a recognised financial qualification such as CFA or accountancy, as well as a relevant degree qualification in finance, business, or a related field.

Understanding of financial analysis, financial markets, and accounting principles (UK IFRS).

Good communication and presentation skills, with the ability to translate complex financial information into easily understandable language.

Awareness of relevant financial regulations and compliance standards.

Experience in financial modelling and data analysis.

The Investor Relations Team is responsible for proactively managing the relationship and communication between SSE and its shareholders. To facilitate this, the Investor Relations team undertakes an annual programme of activity; and ongoing communication with analysts, proxy advisors, ESG ratings agencies and financial ratings agencies to help improve disclosure and allow shareholders to better assess SSE’s performance.
